text: On Tap at Prost! Boise Cloudy almost muddy looking brown. Full tight tan head. Great soft roast flavors and aromas. Rich malty flavors and a smooth thick palate. Lots of tootsie roll and chocolate. Very tasty.

Nice one, how a non-German style can taste German all of a sudden. I am loving these taps, and the ground/earth tones with the true porter flavors make this a great one.

Tap at Walenburg in Rotterdam.

Pours solid brown in color and has excellent head retention. There isnt much lacing with this beer, but you dont miss it too much. The taste is slightly sweet and very malty. A far cry from the hop bitterness of an IPA, but it is a really good beer.

2014 edition. Pours a dark copper colour with a warm beige, almost creamy head with good retention and some thick foamy lacing at the base. Aromas of dark fruits (raisins, dates, plums) with some nutty notes and roasted malts. The taste has these dark fruits, but blended with other fruits like apples, pears and of course, bananas. The roasted malts is mixed with some mild chocolate ones. Hints of coffee in the finish. Lots going on in here making this an interesting wheat porter brew.

7 Jan 2016, bottle. Dark brown. Nose is yeasty, boozy, a bit tart. Thin/med body and moderately fizzy. A bit meaty, faintly acidic, lightly tart, brown malt. This is really unusual. The marriage of porter and heffe is crazy. Its like nothing Ive had. I like it.

Draft Third of a Pint at GBBF 2014, Olympia, London Aug 2014 - Dark Reddish-Brown in colour. Creamy head. Malty; roasty malts, wheaty, caramel, chocolate, coffee. Spicy; cloves. Fruity; dark fruits, hint of banana. Sweetish malty spicy fruity throughout. Dry into the finish. Very drinkable. (2014-08-12)

750 ml bottle (vintage 2014), served in Schneider Weisse weizen glass. Poured dark brown with a three finger tan head. Lively carbonation in glass. Aroma: chocolate, raisins, overripe banana, roasted nuts, dates. Taste: creamy milk chocolate, coffee, overripe banana, clove, toffee, dates, raisins, dark fruit, roasted nuts, bread, some bitter hops. Awesome tasting beer, nice combo of porter and weizen. Drinks almost like a delicious chocolate/banana milkshake. Medium body with a long & nice malty bittersweet finish.

750ml bottle thanks to Steveoj pours out a redish cola color topped with a sand head. Nose is chocolate pit fruit rich malts spice and roast. Taste is more of the pit fruit rich malts a nice spice some bread and the roast chocolate.

Bottle shared at deansos. Dark brown pour with a medium height tan head. Notes of cark fruit, chocolate, sour cherries and cocoa. Medium body and carbonation and a bitter-sweet and lightly tart finish.

Bottle shared. Very dark reddish brown with big beige head. Lots of chocolate, caramel, cocoa beans, light coffee, thick creamy chocolate cake dough, Porto wine, dried plums. Medium sweet and almost medium bitter. Medium bodied with creamy feel. Nice!

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2016 Sampled from bottle at deansos. Clear dark brown with fluffy tan head. Sweet roasted grain, mocca, cocoa powder, dark fruit, bit watery but rich in aroma nonetheless. Medium sweet and bitter. Medium body, thin milk chocolatey feel. Low carbonation.

0.75l bottle. Hazy brown color with tanned head. Aroma is banana, spices, chocolate and caramel. Taste is sweet with wheat and chocolate notes and jist hint of tartness. Overall its very good and interesting beer.

- schöne dunkelbraune Farbe
- starke Schaumbildung welche dann relativ schnell zerfällt
- geruchstechnisch findet man leichte Frucht- bzw. Rauch-
 aromen
- geschmacklich setzt sich dies dann auch fort, wobei dann
 doch das Porter etwas die Oberhand gewinnt
- im Abgang hat man dann endgültig mehr das Gefühl ein
 Porter zu trinken
Fazit: Interessantes und gutes Hybrid-Bier

0.75 l bottle from REWE Budnik & Homberg, 2014 vintage, best before January 2016. Clear, dark ruby with a large, dense, almost stable, beige head. Sweetish, malty and fruity aroma of raisins, prunes, caramel, molasses and a touch of roast. Sweet, malty, fruity and a little yeasty taste of raisins, prunes, caramel, candied cherries, molasses and some port, followed by a medium long, minimally bitter, vinous, slightly roasty and a bit warming-alcoholic finish with notes of dark chocolate, coffee and port. Medium body, slightly creamy and a bit effervescent mouthfeel, soft to average carbonation. Not quite what I expected, its not as chocolaty or coffeish as I would have thought, but its very fruity and port-like (already). High complexity, well-balanced, could only have a bit more body. Still good though, very unique beer!

Bottle at home from drinkstoreBig, rich full bodied beer, moderate carbonation, weisse like spicey aroma with a hint of chocolate. Taste wise its a lot more porter than weisse - toasty, roasty barley, cocoa, dry and earthy, quite rich and aventinus like at times but Id have liked more if the weisse character to come through in flavour.

Bottle at the Aaahhh...Øl!!! Julebord 2015. Dark brown body, staying beige head. Aroma is grainy with banana, roast and spices. Taste is spicy yeast, wood, sweet caramel, ghood body with a solid yeast and roast finish.
Deep and dark. Strong notes of bitter chocolate with molasses and a touch of dark dried fruit.

Thanks to Travlr! Sampled draft @ cause BEER loves FOOD. Black, little tanned head. Nose is werid mushroom roast, sugar, umami, candy, herbal, thick syrupy qualities. Taste is strangely vegetable, molasses, bark, pectin, blue grape syrup, sugar, roots, sugar, herbal syrup. Low molasses, sugar, syrup body. Strange brew but not without merits. Interesting experiment.

Pours dark brown with a large foamy mocha head. Aromas of brown sugar, chocolate, lactose, roasted malt, roasted nuts. Taste is quite sweet with roasted notes and chocolate. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation

2014. Black, caramel head. 
Very malty, caramel, bitter chocolate, blackberries, banana, dried fruits. 
Soft carbonation, sweet, malty, subtil bitterness, a hint of banana. Excellent.
Bottle. Amazing stuff. Loved every sip. Great combo of weisse and porter. Very fresh. Amazing beer.
Black of color with a beige head. An aroma of roasted malt, prunes, port, liqurice and leather. A flavor of roasted malt,coffee,liqurice, leather and charcoal.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

(Bottle, 0.75 l - 2014 vintage, at tiongs tasting, thanks tiong, 20160109) The beer poured black. Its head weas quite large and lightly brown. Aroma had chocolate and burnt malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were vanilla, burnt malts, sweetness, ash and bitterness. Aftertaste was burnt and sweet. An interesting porter with hefeweizen notes here and there.

Donkerbruin, bijna zwart, bier met rode gloed. Schuimkraag verdwijnt snel. Aroma van mout, koffie, rozijn, vanille. Smaak is bitter, begint ook licht zoet en evolueert naar zuur. Volle body, fijne film, zacht en licht tintelend.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2016 Negra com ótima formação de espuma marrom de média densidade e duração. Notas de malte tostado, cravo, nuances frutados e boa presença de lúpulo. Corpo médio com final longo, amadeirado e com amargor e dulçor em harmonia

Bottle. 7.0%. Best before 02.01.16; 1 month past. Pours a dense, dark reddish brown with a fluffy, tan head. Heavy, malty and dark fruit aroma; plums, light raisins, and with a light sour overtone. Hints of pepper as it warms. Flavour is sweet with a sugary hint. Dark fruits, plums. Remote note of pepper. Bitter finish, with a light alcohol burn, lingering, followed by a grassy/apple note. Juicy hint as it warms. A wee bit too much carbonation. Overall pretty good and well-balanced. 02.02.16.

750 ml well stored bottle consumed January 2015. Dark brown to black body with a fair beige head. Nice aroma of softly roasted dark malt, caramel, dry fruit and some yeast. Flavor has as expected both elements from a roasted porter and dunkelweisse. Sweet, dark, light roasted malt, dark chocolate, some coffee, caramel, dry fruit, wheat and bubblegum yeast flavor. Moderate in bitterness and otherwise really smooth. Fine balanced full bodied with a long lasting delicious aftertaste. A really nice one.

2014 Bottle. Smooth malty caramel in the beginning. Easy to drink, soft and roasted. Fresh with a dry chocolate smooth body. Easy to drink with a nice intense slightly sourish chocolate yeasty ending. Great dark chocolate stuff.
Draught @ Drinkers Pub (Eindhoven). Chocolate and coffee aroma. Rich taste of aforementioned flavours, but with a freshness of Weiss beer. Subtle aftertaste.

750ml bottle (tasting @tiongs, thanks). Dark murky brown color. Medium size, brown head, stays. Metallic, minerals, wheat, banana and dusty yeast in aroma. Caramel, banana, yeasty, fruity taste. Sweet banana in aftertaste. Soft carbonation. Nice brew.

pours with large head, smells like a lighter beer than it looks...medium dark malt smell, taste is smooth maltiness, cant taste much in the way of hops, one dimentional malt taste though... Nothing exciting...straightforward

750ml bottle - thanks tiong and the rest of the posse!
I can get a lovely tight persistent head on this from the longer pour, and its a beautiful dark colour, basically black. Aroma is banana strings, toffee and vanilla. Rich malty body, wheaty, banana, sweetish, some toffee. Fullish. Finish a bit drying. Didnt quite deliver what it promised in the first few seconds, but still decent.

750 ml bottles. 2014 vintage. Courtesy of tiong. 
Black color with a small light tan head. 
Mild aroma of wheat, sweetness and malt.
Wheat, banana, toffee, yeast, some unfreshness and sweet malt in the aroma. Porter Weisse? 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 0.75l at tiongs, Espoo. Thanks tiong! Colour is dark brown with very small white head. Aromas and flavours: Chocolate, grain, dryness and malts.

750ml bottle
2014 vintage - Pours dark ruby brown, almost black with a smooth head. Aroma of roasty malts, hints of wheatiness, yeast and chocolate. Taste is smooth, slightly wheaty and roasty with hints of banana, coffee and earthiness. Finish is smooth and earthy with some grainy notes, hints of banana and roastiness. Decent.

Bottle bbe 02.01.16. Dark brown hazy pour with a huge brownish head.
Aroma: ripe fruit, caramel, dark malts, slight yeasty
Taste: roasted malts, dried fruit, caramel, hints of lactic sourness
Overall: Pretty decent Weizenbock that gets an extra kick from the lactic sourness. Nice idea of combining Porter and Weissbier, but could be more intense.

0,75l bottle at home. BB 02.01.2016. dark brown hazy color, rather big tan head. smells of ripe fruits, caramel, licorice, earthy, light roast, some plums and raisins, light coffee. nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick / light creamy mouthfeel. tastes of caramel, fruity, plums, some ripe fruits, raisins, lightly sourish, light licorice, a bit earthy, very light coffee, light roast, some alcohol noticeable, light sweetness. finishes lightly alcoholic with notes of caramel, some licorice and dried fruits. overall quite good stuff, a bit alcoholic but not in a bad way, would prefer a bit more roast.

Bottle: (2014)
nearly black, with a creamy tan head.
Caramel, chocolate, banana aroma.
Caramel malt, dark wheat, mild banan flavor.
Sweet, roasty, creamy....a slight lactic sourness to the finish.
Pretty enjoyable.

Very dark brown color with medium-lasting, tan head. Complex aroma of dried plums, overripe banana, chocolate, chicory coffee, roastiness and wheat. Taste is well balanced. Medium sweetness with light bitterness and sourness. Medium carbonation, medium body and creamy texture. Great stuff.
Neat blend of wizened bock & porter. The weizenith part is a bit tart. And a nice foil to the porter component.

Rossa molto scura con riflessi rubino e caramello, schiuma beige di persistenza medio-bassa.
Aroma di ciliegia e prugna, leggera banana matura, cacao, leggerissimo chiodo di garofano.
Al palato sempre ciliegia e prugna, sul finale cacao amaro e caffè tostato più in secondo piano.
Retrolfatto di prugna e cacao.
Corpo medio, ben carbonata, leggermente watery.

Bottle. Brown with medium creamy head. Aroma: Roasted malts, banana, yeasty, bread, plums, domino cookie, toffee, berries. Taste: wheaty, chocolate, coffee bitterness, bread, roasted, Medium body. Bitter finiosh. Nice beer.
Flaske i Kvickly Middelfart. Farven er sort/brun med en brunlig skumkrone. Aromaen er karamel, brød og solbær medens smagen er brød, chokolade, nødder, rosiner og kaffe,
Bottle. Pour is dark with a caramel frothy head, aroma is caramel, toffee. Taste is toffee, malty, nutty. Great

Bottle. Herbal hay, banana, clove, chocolate, and wheat malt aroma. Dark chestnut brown with large tan head. Sweet chocolate wheat malt, banana, and mildly bitter herbal hay / ash flavor. Nice body. Interesting.

Bottle. Black, browny. Soft roasty, bit chocolately, ripe estery nose. Med bodied, some young woodyness, roasty chocolate, bit burnt rubber, overripe banana, malted wheat sweetness. Flavourful, right nice german hefe yeast- y roasty drink. Neither the roast nor the weiss is too much.-- bb

Hazy brown liquid with minimal tan head. Aroma of caramel bread, wild berries, currant. Taste: bread crust, chocolate, medium sweet, light bitter, light sour. Palate: medium body, creamy feel, long coffee finish

Bottle 75cl / Botella 75cl.
@ Iberico y Vino, Bejar (Salamanca), España.
A: Dark brown / Marron oscuro.
T/S: Roasted malt, sweet, chocolate, yeast / Malta tostada, dulce, chocolate, levadura.

From 0,75l bottle, BBD: Pours hazy dark brown liquid, big frothy brown head, Aroma:sweet, banana, coffee, clove, flowers, vanilla, candied apricot, Taste: medium sweet, light to medium bitter, light to medium sour, fruity, banana, vanilla, candied apricot, black coffee, roasty notes, clove, Palate: medium body, slick to creamy texture, average carbonation, long fruity aftertaste, Overall: excellent brew, fruity, candied, clove, roasty, enjoyed.

Pours nearly black with a brownish middle-sized head. The aroma features raw chocolate, dattes and wheatish malty and yeasty notes. The flavor is somewhat bitter and fruity with some cloying wheaty notes. Light roasted notes.
Trübes sehr dunkles braun mit bräunlich eingefärbter Schaumkrone. Röstmalze, Nüsse, Rosinen, Kaffee, würzig, sehr lecker.

Bottle from Bierzwerg, Greven. Pours pitch black with a big creamy tanned head. Aroma of dark light roasted malts, dark fruits and yeast with a delicious whiff of liquorice. Smooth & creamy mouthfeel. Taste is weak sweet, dark malty with solid dark fruits lingering, tasty and moreish beer.
Botella de @Vivalabirra, Oviedo 26/07/2015. BBD: 02/01/2016. Color negro, espuma beige poco persistente, aromas torrefactos, sabor maltoso, torrefacto, final seco.

[7083-20150228] 1pt9.4floz bottle. Fruity banana grains aroma. Hazy, dark brown black body with a long-lasting creamy off-white head. Roasted woody grains and fruity banana flavour. Medium-full body. Good. (7/3/7/3/15) 3.5
The aroma is sweet banana, chewing gum and some sweet tobacco. The flavor is somewhat bitter and fruity with some cloying wheaty notes.
Bottle. Dark amber brown pour, with a light tan head. Roast, fruity esters, wheat, moderately sweet, mild coffee, and notes of chocolate and banana. Medium bodied. Ok.

6/29/15. 750mL bottle from Bleu Cafe, purchased by my dad, thankfully (expensive at a bar). Dark Amber pour with a nice khaki head, good lacing. Nice aroma, really does remind of a mix of porter and weisse... light fruitiness, but also coffee, caramel. Nice flavor, soft wheat, caramel, chocolate, coffee, light banana. Not bad.
Bottled. A hazy amber beer with a huge tan head. The aroma has notes of malt and caramel. The flavor is sweet malt, caramel, wheat, and fruits, leading to a dry finish.
Bottled. Brownish colorued. Unclear. dense light brown head. aroma. sweetness, light roast, spice. flavour. herbs, sweetness, roast, medium bodied. sweet and light roasted bitter. end .

Aroma and taste is a mix of sweet and toasty malts, some dark dried fruits, some banana, light spices, pretty decent brew overall.

hazy brown, small fluffy light brown.
aroma is dark fruity, faint malty. flavor is dark dried fruity, very nice and tight.
75 cL bottle. Pours hazy brown with a small tan head. Aroma is toasted malty and caramelish. Toasted. Dark malty and roasted into the finish. Dry and roasted finish. Light liqourice.

Large bottle: split between four of us at the 24th June 2015 Shrewsbury Bottle Exchange Group meeting. Cheers Mat for this unusual and interesting beer. Strange brew to be honest, poured a lively dark brown with an off-white cap. Malty aroma with a fruity ester or two: I tried to find banana and vanilla (my go too Weiss bier aromas) but failed to find them, the maltiness being a little overpowering in the nose, plum and coffee notes as the beer warmed a little. The taste was also dark malt first in dominance with the wheat way back in the distance. The plums and coffee smells that arrived late in the nose come through in the taste a little stronger to add an extra dimension to the flavour. OK, rather than fantastic and I am not convinced the two styles actually work together that well.
Bottle from Bier-Deluxe.de/ Brown color with huge off-white head. Aroma of wheat, roasted malt, banana. Sweet taste of dark malt, banana, chocolate, clove, bready notes. Tasty.

Delt 0,75 l flaske. Svært kropp med høyt lysebrunt skum. Frisk gjær river i nesa rett etter ølet er helt i. Deretter kommer mer mørke frukter sammen med dadler og en deilig sødme. Deilig røstede, toner, litt lakris, malt og tørkede frukter.

Surprisiingly smooth beer for such a pairing. I have just chewed through a Renaissance cherry porter and this beer is extremely pleasant and easy to drink. I agree it is more levelled towards a Weisse beer than a porter, with lots of fruity flavours in the palate, but it pours nice and rich brown with a good head, and lacing. Enjoyable.

Odkapslowanie kończy się wystrzałem jak z szampana, choć korka pod kapslem nie ma, nie ma też mowy o gaszingu (poza świetnym dymkiem wydobywającym się spod kapsla). Po przelaniu do szkła tworzy się beżowa, sycząca piana, średnio pęcherzykowa, dość szybko opadająca do obrączki. Barwa ciemno brązowa, mętna, nieprzejrzysta. W aromacie faktycznie doszukać się można nut porterowych - czekolada, kawa zbożowa, prażone ziarno, karmel, ale także piwa pszenicznego czy dunkela - delikatna kwaskowość pszeniczna, melanoidyny w postaci chleba razowego, suszone śliwki, rodzynki a nawet banan i zioła. Jest więc bogato i wielopłaszczyznowo. W smaku dzieje się dokładnie to samo - jest wyrazistość porteru i łagodność weizena, lekka słodycz kandyzowanych owoców, trufli i toffi miesza się z orzeźwiającą kwaskowatością skórki od chleba, pikantnością, winem domowym z głogu. Goryczka gorzkiej czekolady, pestek wiśni i przypraw jest znakomitą choć subtelną kontrą. W afterteasie rozgrzewający likier kakaowy i mus jabłkowy oraz odrobina pieprzu. Nagazowanie niewysokie, drobne, odczucie w ustach dość pełne. 
Niesamowita mieszanka dwóch zupełnie innych smaków i aromatów w przedziwny sposób współgra tu ze sobą tworząc świetnie skomponowany i ułożony trunek. Generalnie profil jest deserowy, ale dzięki orzeźwiającym cechom piw pszenicznych jest zdumiewająco pijalne. W smaku przypomina nieco bardziej wytrawnego dubbla lub quadrupla.

Bottle at Ølfestival 2015.
Dark brown coloured with a small off-white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of caramel and dried fruits with roasted notes.
Light roasted flavour of caramel with notes of licorice.
Light roasted finish.
Bottle, 750 ml from Vrutak, Zagreb. Shared with JFK10000. Pours dark unclear brown with white head. Caramel, dark fruit, spices, banana, sweetish. Medium bodied.

Bottle from Dranken Geers, Oostakker, Nr Gent, Belgie, consumed at home Friday 15th May 2015   Black with light beige head looks like a Guinness. Fruity from the off, but a little thin and a touch watery, some plums and wheat a little yeast noted. Its absolutely fine but nowt exciting. A6 A4 T6 P3 Ov12 3.1

Deep, dull dark brown color. A thin Beige Necklace very creamy, high and constant. Well carbonated with lace adhering the walls of glass along the tasting.

The aroma is warm with soft notes of coffee with medium roast, a pleasant sensation of chocolate with an intense, striking and delicious banana with toffee as well, of dark fruits like plums, raisins, a fig is present, wheat and nuances a light and spicy yeast emerges grounded in nutmeg, licorice and cloves. A delicious fresh pasta candied fruit bread that in Brazil we call panettone.

Taste is a little of what is sweet note in the aroma. The typical spicy sensation licorice Weizenbock a banana syrup is present. It also shows in its taste a light coffee with a touch of caramel and beautiful and intense bananas contained in this and wheat. Very fruity flavor. Accompanying these is present the very fine dark chocolate with spicy notes of clove, nutmeg and again the delicious fresh pasta candied fruit bread highlighting the raisins and prunes. All these flavors are grounded by a beautiful Malte Torrado in the finish and maybe a slight smoked.

Medium to full body in a low carbonation suitable for weiss style with a slightly creamy texture and balanced sweet sorrow. Its effervescence felt in the mouth is a little more noticeable.
The Aftertaste is of medium length and slightly malty with bananas and hardly notice the bitterness. It is clear the total absence in the flavor of hops.

A Refreshing Weiss with a hint of acidity in a very slight tendency Porter. A balanced and good drinkability together.
An excellent beer!

Bouteille de 750 ml partagée lors dune dégustation entre amis. Arôme: Légère odeur de café et de chocolat. Apparence: La couleur est brune foncée opaque. Présence dun mince col beige mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de de café avec une pointe de caramel et de bananes. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de bananes en arrière goût. (Rating #6246)
More weisen than porter. Good taste of banana ans roasted malt. Aromas of lemon and chocolate. Smooth and medium roundness. Weird mix but well-done!

Deep dark brown color with a very nice off-white head that keeps a losing until the end. Aroma is toasty, notes of coffee and dark fruits like plums and black berries. Flavor follow the aroma but a little bit sweeter and with wheat notes. Low carbonation and medium to full body with a balanced sweet bitterness. Good one!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone 4S
KRS 111014. Black colour with a beige head. Flavour is sweet, roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, licorice, alcohol, wheat, banana. Very nice beer.

2015-02-28. Very dark brown-black body with a nice foamy tan head. 4+ Aroma is sweet, lightly yeasty weissbeer esters, whispers of roast and dark malt. Flavour is similar with mildly yeasty wheaty undercurrents throughout, lightly dusty dry roast accents. Smooth average plus bodied palate. Odd mix of flavours but the overall impression is surprisingly nice. Bottle from the LCBO, Toronto.

My Bottom Line:
Cherries, cloves and roasted cereals move into fruity acidity in this Weizenbock-like creation.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A slice of foam tops the reddish brown.
-The wheat beer yeast is much more apparent than the Porter-like grain bill.
-Drinkability is still high.
-While this is a pleasant experiment, I would still go back to their regular offerings when looking for something in a Weissbierbrauerei portfolio.

Bottle.
Somewhat of a dunkel and not too sweet. A decent blend of porter on a wheat porter. Nicely drinkable during the daytime.
I think this is a really cool beer: nothing Ive had before. It has the flavour of a porter but is still refreshing like a wheat beer. I highly recommend.

750ml bottle shared at tasting. Massive cloudy off-white head. Interesting merging of a porters roasty aroma and a hefes banana-clove. Nice fruity Weizenbock tones on top of that. Real fluffy and light on the palate. Raisin, brown chocolate, purple plum. Very drinkable, but the roast malt gives it a hint of chalkiness, as opposed to the lush richness you might expect in a true Weizenbock. Pretty good.

Couleur brune sombre, légère mousse beige cremeuse. Nez fruits noirs (pruneaux, figues), malté, cassonade, caramel un peu grillé avec note de weisse (levures et banané). Gout malté, fruité figue et raisin, note weisse fruité banane puis note de cacao. Corps bien rond presque cremeux. Fin de bouche fruits noirs, banane et note caramel. Pas mal le mélange weisse et porter. Toujours nickel du coté de chez Schneider!

Sample at the Fred. Muddy brown, with a medium, bubbly, beige head. Nose is peanut butter, milk chocolate, banana, cloves, and a touch of wheat and rye. Sweet and estery flavor. Heavy body, creamy, and thick. Nice and aromatic, with a lovely, creamy mouthfeel. Cloyingly sweet and far too much ester.

Bottle from Beermoth, Manchester. Pours nearly black with a brownish middle-sized head. The aroma features raw chocolate, dattes and wheatish malty and yeasty notes. Taste is fairly sweet, definitely tilted more toward wheat beer than porter. Fruity, wheaty notes prevail with some chocolaty, light roasty notes balancing. Medium bodied, slick palate with a moderate carbonation. Tasty and drinkable.
Black unclear colloured beer white a white head. Taste is raisin, chocolade, coffee, fnuts, fruity, vanille and some nice weisse bitterness.

Colore molto scuro, nero con qualche riflesso rossastro.
Schiuma bruna, soffice.
Odore ricco di caramello, tostato, cioccolato e sentori più tipici da weiss.
Sapore dolciastro, orzo tostato, cioccolato, leggermente astringente sul finale.
Un bellibrido.

Bottle, thanks Jonas! Medium brown and muddy. Thick head. Odd mix of weizen phenols and chocolate...weird schwarzweizenbock. Sweet, bit tart with overripe fruits. Actually balances out with banana/apple in the finish but the overall combination of flavours is not especially compelling.
Dark brown with a medium off-white head. Aroma is sweet with notes of wheat, sugar and banana. Taste is wheat and some fruit.

Bottle. It pours dark ruby brown with a medium beige head. The aroma is sweet banana, chewing gum and some sweet tobacco. The flavor is somewhat bitter and fruity with some cloying wheaty notes. Light roasted notes.
Bottle shared with the Port City crew, nice drinking with you! Clear brown color, small tan head. Aroma of brownies. Taste is roasty caramel. Tasty.

Bottle, 750mL. Home. With dad & mom. A dark brown beer with a big off-white creamy head ; good retention. Roasty aroma of caramel, grape, plum, banana (?), nut, biscuit, cereal. Transfer from BA review on 4-13-14-

 Poured from bottle into a pint glass

 Appearance  The beer pours a nice dark brown color with a one finger head of a dark cream color. The head has a great level of retention, slowly fading to leave a ton of foamy lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell  The aroma of the beer is strongest of a dark fruit smell s of a raisin, fig, and cherry nature mixed with plenty of chocolate aromas. Other fruity aromas of a lighter fruit nature are there as well with aromas of banana, pineapple, and papaya are there as well. These are mixed with a bit of a wheaty bread aroma and some booze, which combined with the other aromas to give a rather chocolate wheat fruitcake like smell. 

 Taste  The taste begins a rather decent showing for some darker fruit tastes with good dose of a wheat bread taste. Along with these flavors is a little bit of chocolate and a slight yeasty taste. As the flavor advances the wheat flavors increase in intensity with them being accompanied by an increase in the yeasty flavors as well. The chocolate flavors lose ground as the taste advances as darker fruit flavors of fig and raisin come to the tongue. Along with the increase in darker fruits, there is also a big development of some banana and lighter fruit flavors of a pineapple and papaya nature. With some light boozy flavors as well as a little bit of an earthy and hay like hop flavor coming to the tongue at the very end of the taste, one is left with a nice and smooth darker fruited wheat flavor to linger on the tongue..

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the thicker and creamier side with a carbonation level that is on the higher side. The big carbonation is great for the weizen style of the brew, all while the thicker feel is rather nice for the darker flavors of the brew. Overall, it was very nicely done.

 Overall  This was a tasty and very easy drinking weizen. It has a nice blend of fruits, wheat and yeast to make for a nice clean and smooth drinking brew. A good one to try if you get the chance.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2014 Grundsätzlich empfindet man ein gewisses Vergnügen eine solche Flasche zu präsentieren und gemeinsam zu probieren. Schon der Geruch und Anblick dieses Bieres ist für Biergeniesser sicherlich eine Wonne. Dunkel und eine königliche Schaumkrone. Der Geruch ist mit Malznoten bespickt aber die durchdringende Kraft ist die Hefe und Röst sowie Rauchnoten. Die Fruchtigkeitsnuanchen kann ich mir mehr vorstellen als tatsächlich erriechen. Der Einstieg ist etwas mischmasch - diese Bier bedarf einen 2. und 3. Schluck. Manch einer wird den 2. und 3. Schluck erst geniessen können. Es hat etwas von Stout (Guiness) und von einem dunklem Weizen. Das ist ungewohnnt, kann aber funktionieren. Ob es das auch schafft kann ich auch bis zum Ende des Glasses, mich nicht entscheiden. Ein Bier was man getrunken und versucht haben will. Ein fast gelungener Versuch aus zwei Bierarten, eine Neue zu kreieren. Lobenswert.

750 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 1/2/2014. Pours hazy nearly opaque dark brown color with a 2 finger dense and rocky khaki head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice dense soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a good amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Aromas of big banana, raisin, chocolate, cocoa, caramel, toast, dark bread, clove, pepper, wheat, herbal, light nuttiness, and yeast earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of dark/roasted/bready malt and fruity/spicy yeast ester notes; with good strength. Taste of big banana, raisin, chocolate, cocoa, caramel, toast, dark bread, wheat, clove, pepper, herbal, light nuttiness, and yeast earthiness. Lingering notes of banana, raisin, chocolate, cocoa, caramel, wheat, toast, dark bread, clove, herbal, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice robustness and complexity of dark/roasted/bready malt and fruity/spicy yeast flavors; with a great malt/yeast flavor balance with zero cloying after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a moderately creamy, smooth, and lightly bready/chalky mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is well hidden with only a slight warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent weizen bock. All around great complexity, balance, and robustness of dark/roast/bready malt and fruity/spicy yeast flavors; and very smooth to sip on. A very enjoyable offering.

50th rating for this brew, from 2014s 750mL edition, only crowned with with a deep plastic insert. Nose is heavily phenolic, bubblegum pushing past clove and pairing with spicy notes, red berries -- an intense and pretty classic hot-fermented weizen character. Pours deep brown, opaque and yeasty with amber peaking out around the sides and bottom, aggressive carbonation, super-dense and rocky tan head. Taste semi-dry with strong tang, very mellow light body, soft and smooth and swirling. Doesnt seem nearly as effervescent in the mouth (actually closer to flat!  Shocking!), but the lips are sticky enough. Again, strong phenolic character, this time mingling and merging with strong (but not boozy) heat; the expected Porter notes (chocolate, light roast, bitterness) are faint, and its a bit more like a Brown Porter at that. Those red berries are very jammy, and my perceived sweet tooth is very interested. Really like the spice and theres some good malt development under the yeast. Insignificant hops. Honestly, I dont care if they call it a Porter-Weisse or a Weizenbock or whatever, I just wish all Dunkelweizen were like this, or at least used it as their base reference.

Overall : Interesting, but too alcoholic. Where is the Porter? Its more like strong Dunkel weizen bock.

75cl. Bottle. 
Pours almost black brown with light brown head. 
Aroma sweet, banana, chocolate, roasted malts, vanille. 
Taste banana, chocolate sweet, coffee bitter hints. 
Mouthfeel creamt, some carbo. 
Nice beer, expected more but still nice.

Tap at Maxs. Pours clear brown with a medium, frothy off-white head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is toast, caramel, and nutty malt with dates, earthy hops and cinnamon. Flavor is sweet malt dominant with light hops and medium bitterness, dark fruits and a dry finish. Medium to full body and medium carbonation.

75cl bottle at home. Dark amber brown with a medium off-white head. Medium body with light to medium moderation. Sweetness combined with bitter- and sourness. Caramel, brown sugar, wheat, spices and vanilla. A very decent complex brew.
Mooie donkerbruine kleur met een volle bruine kraag. Ruikt fruit, vanille, mout en iets gebrand. Smaakt fruit, hop, chocolade. Beetje alcohol nasmaak.
Very nice, manages to be a good marriage of Hefeweizen banana flavours and the chocolate usually found in a good Porter.
0.75l bottle. Very dark brown, almost black body, huge light brown head. Aroma and taste if banana and chocoate. Nice experiment.

Smells just like the other Schneider Weiss beers. Heavy banana aroma. Pour is really awesome. Like a Guinness effect as the head collects and rolls around. Very silky beer and light. Not sure about the pairing of Porter and Weiss in the end. A cool experiment, but in the end not the most successful.

Draft to taster at Dutchs. Looks good; a cloudy dark brown with foamy light beige head. Smells solid; clove and banana with notes of mild dark malt. Tastes like it smells with a solid mouthfeel. Maybe a touch of dark fruit too. A nice example of the style.

Draft at Dutchs. Pours an opaque amber brown color with a larger creamy khaki head. The aroma and flavor have some toasted malt, sweet caramel and some fruity character, lighter bodied so it leans more toward a weizen than a porter. Decent flavor, some spices, malt forward, mild bitterness to thefinish.

Draft. Poured dark reddish brown with an average fizzy off-white head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Moderate complex roasted coffee and small sweet malt aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium complex chocolate coffee flavor with a medium smooth toasted finish of moderate duration. This is a solid beer.

Bottle. Pours murky coffee brown with abundant, creamy and stable tan head. Clear aroma of caramel malt, banana, and yeast, with subtle notes of chocolate. Sweetish flavour of caramel malt, with estery touches, and notes of banana and coffee. Bitter aftertaste with hints of roast. Nice, although not much of a Porter, meine oder nicht meine.

Bottle, 7.0%. Slightly wheaty aroma, does not smell much of porter. Cloudy dark brown colour. Big stable, creamy light brown head. The flavour starts off a little roasted, and then comes a rather citric wheat beer flavour. A little salty, perhaps salt liquorice. Perhaps not a Dunkelweizen, but that is what it reminds me most of. I do not get much porter from this.

750ml bottle at Samo Pivo in Belgrade. Shared with ippopotamo36, grazie! Dark malty brown with huge tan head. Quite rich carbonation. Huge sweet malt body with whiff of creamy wheat. Creamed body for these dark malts. Sweet soft funk. Some banana and dark grain. Interesting beer.

Bottled, thanks to caesar for sharing. Black appearance, medium head. Sweet aroma of roasted malts, wheat, some chocolate. Quite sweet malty flavor, wheat, banana. Thick mouthfeel. The combination of two styles works out really well,

On tap at Dutchs. Pours a hazy darker brown color, with a thin light brown head, leaves loose lace. Big aroma of banana in that nose; big banana-type german hefe yeast character. Some light chocolate, toastiness, general biscuity malt breadiness. It does indeed drink more like a weizenbock than a wheat porter. Moderate sweet taste. Smooth, lightly soft lighter carbonation, lightly slick texture. Not as thick or full as I might have hoped, though not terribly thin either. Interesting, tasty stuff.

Bottled, BB 02.01.2016, large sample. Dark brown color, big off-white head. Aroma of some chocolate and coffee, banana, some earthy hop. Bit sweet in taste, some bitterness from the dark malts. Easy going combination of a porter and a hefeweizen.

on tap at kulovy blesk in prague and then at braukunst in munich. very close to black with a huge beige head; aroma of musky yeast; hints of salted licorice, cocoa powder and salted caramel; surprsingly dry for a strong wheat beer. a decent experiment - ive always wondered what a dunkelweizen would be like with 3 times the dark malt and this seems to have answered the question, though might be a disaster in less capable hands than schneiders

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks Yoav. Dark cloudy brown with a stable beige head. Nice aroma with lots of banana, bubblegum, caramel and a light citric hint. Sweetish flavor, caramelly, with light roastiness, a chocolate hint, a light tart note, fruity esters, bubblegum and a slightly more roasty finish. Medium-bodied. Very little Porter character here, but its a nice dark Weizenbock.

750ml bottle. Hazy dark brown colour with huge, thick, creamy, fully lasting, moderately lacing, beige head. Fruity, yeasty, minimally wheaty aroma, chocolately background, cocoa, hints of pear, red berries, cherry, pink peppery yeasty notes. Taste is minimally sweet fruity, wheaty, yeasty, notes of pear, apple, a chocolately touch, cocoa, spicy, yeasty overtones. Very interesting, unusual, explores a not so obvious idea, but for all that still not sufficiently audacious. Would have liked more chocolate and maybe a touch of smoke.

Draught @Braukunst Live, München 02/2014 SA. "...crowed [sic] with a fine-pored, creamy head."? - A porter-black crow wearing a fully Weisse cap? Indeed a boldish combination, at least by denomination. Pours a murky but light hazelnut brown. Pillows of the otherwise heavy-set Schn.W yeast whip up creamy roasted malts, creating a very pleasant mouthfeel and fruity rather than cocoa-forward tasting notes: plum, pear, ripe strawberry, rounded off by a green pepper hop finish. Excellent flan soufflé of a beer dessert.

Tap @ In De Wildeman. Dark brown color, murky. Off white head. Aromas: strong banana, some wheat, plus some herbal spiciness retronasal. Flavor is light sweet, with some wheaty fruitiness. Medium bodied. Finishes with a bit of roast and moderate bitterness. Nice beer, but could have use a bit more roast for true porter character.

Draught at Braukunst Live, black with a fine tan head, nose is banana with just a faint choc hint. Smooth and more like a Dunkelweiss until late in the body, when touches of treacle and a light roastiness emerge.

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2014 Rerate at Weisses bräuhaus: Light vineous roast and fruit aroma. Black, creamy brown lace. Light, dry base, chocolate and roast base, a bit Aventinus fruitiness. Dry wooden dark Choc finish. I am missing the velvety wheat notes this time around Old rating: 7 4 8 4 14 Tap at BKL 2014. Murky brown, amber lace. Roast chocolate and dunkel weisse aroma. Deep flavors, vineous, roast, Aventinus fruityness,with extra berries. dry roast finish. Medium full body. Tastes like a drier Aventinus really

(draught) pours a murky amber-brown colour with a frothy light-beige head. aroma of heavy banana, cheesecake and yeast, with notes of vanilla, bubble gum, light flan base, cherries and dark chocolate. flavour is heavy raisins and liquorice, with a hint of cherries, treebark, some light alcohol, banana, pears and roasted wheat. medium to heavy-bodied with average carbonation.
Draft, from dewilderman in Amsterdam , fantastic perfume, and full on flavour.

Bottle Nice nearly black body with off white head. Aroma is not very strong compared to other wheat beers or porters some hints of yeast some banana and some roasted malts. Taste is malts with yeast but nothing realy strong but also very drinkable. Aftertaste is malts some roasted malts and a little bit of hop bitterness. Nice one but I think there is something missing.

2014 bottle. Deep dark brown color, cloudy. Raisin, banana, red fruit and a hint of roast in the aroma. Banana, roast, red fruit and coffee in the flavor. Full bodied. Not too sweet. fairly complex. Good beer.
Tap in de Wildeman. Troebel bruin, beige kraag. Aroma vooral banaan. Smaak is een interessante combinatie tussen een weizen (banaan, kruidnagel) en een porter (gebrande mout, melasse)
Poured a bubbly dark brown with a frothy white head. Aroma of sweet berries and caramel malt. Medium body,flavour is much as the aroma, moderately sweet.

(bottle, 75cl) Almost black colour with a big and beige, very firm foamy head. Roasty malty, delicately wheaty aroma with notes of liquorice, leather, traces of chocolate and a subtle fruity touch, backed by a mildly level of sourness (great!). Mildly sweet, slightly roasty bitter and delicately sour flavour, unfortunately only medium bodied with a smooth carbonation. Mildly roasty malty and moderately wheaty taste with notes of cacao, liquorice, mocha and caramel; delicately sweet and mildly roasty bitter finish. A very aromatic and complex hybrid beer, not so full bodied according to its base styles. How about an Imp. Stout Weizenbock !? 04.II.14

Dark brown colour with a light beige head with medium lasting. Aroma has notes of caramel, toffee, some chocolate and slightly banana. Flavor is sliggtly sweet, hints of spices, chocolate and burnt sugar is also present in a good proportion. Slightly sweet in the final with spiced notes.

Bottle. Thanks Tomas. Pours dark murky Brown with a creamy head. Aroma is a mix of banana yeast and roasty chocolate malt. Very yeasty and quite a stand out beer. Like the 5p chocolate bananas that are left to grow old on the counter of a corner shop. I would definitly place it higher than the Ratebeer scores seem to..

Irgendwie weiß das Bier nicht so recht, was es will. Die Unausgeglichenheit zieht sich von A bis Z durch und am Ende hat man ein Gemisch aus einem süßen Weizenbock und einem milden Stout oder Porter. Die Aromen sind zwar vielfältig, aber laff und vollkommen dumpf. Für diese Preisklasse eine absolute Verschwendung an guten Rohstoffen.
On tap. Smells like dryed banana with a little bit brandy. Sweetie beginning with dry ending.

Pours out of the bottle in a deep dark, black colour with steady, low, creamy head and medium body. Aroma of coffee, earth and yeast. Taste of yeast, torf, woods, plums, bitter coffee and light chocolate. Earthy finish. Nice one, not that quaffable and easy to drink, though. Too yeasty for me but really not bad at all.

On tap @ Van Moll. Murky brown pour with creamy off white head. Aroma of chocolate, cocoa, banana, wheat, light toasty notes. Taste is bitter, powdery cocoa, banana sweetness, light clove, light roastiness. Palate is light med bodied, a bit thin, light carbonation. I like the chocolate/banana combination going on here, but it is far from aventinus, which offers a superior experience of the same type IMO.
Pours a dark brown beer with a good tannish white head. Smells boring, some coffee and chocolate. Tastes some fruity, coffee and flat. Average carbo, thin body and a sticky texture.
Draught @ Van Moll Brewpub. Very dark brown color, medium sized tan head. Smell and taste sweetish, quite fruity, bitter. Hmm its ok, but Im not really enthusiastic.
Tap @ van moll. Dark brown colour, small beige head. Smells chocolate, mint, banana. Tastes chocolate, banana, sweet, wheat. Medium body, soft carbo.
Draught at Green week. Black with a huge tan head. Aroma is banana and toast. Flavor is fruity, vanilla, warm malty toast, liquorice, mild alcohol in the finish. Works well

The best kind of experiments are those that seem wildly wrong at first, but end up being oh(!) so good. Luckily, Meine Porter Weisse falls into this category. Although its more porter than weisse--the beer has a dark mahogany, almost black shade and a porters familiar coffee and chocolate notes and flavors--hints of clove certify its weissbier half. The result is hearty yet smooth beer that belies its alcohol percentage and offers a new twist on the standard English porter.

What a delight to imbibe! Silky smooth, soft water with an refreshingly nuanced finish. Several sensations, never dull - exciting to drink. I hope this beer catches on in Germany and makes its way to the menu. Next time Id like to eat something with it and see how it performs with some hearty German food. In a word, Wunderbar!

Reading the scientific details of this experiment is an interesting thing and will wake your interest, but you know nothing until youve tasted the astonishing result!

Combining the best of Schneiders wheat beer yin and some serious porter yang created something that is better than just the sum of both. 

Its a nearly black and slightly cloudly beer with a lively carbonation. Youll notice the typical chocolate and coffee aromas of a good porter at the same time youll have some subtle banana flavor on your nose.

The taste comes in waves of as if the two beer styles did not mix, but are filled into the bottle in layers. First youll notice the chocolate, caramel malt and coffee flavors of the porter. The next wave is even more refreshing and brings the flavors of hops and banana which are so typical for Schneiders beers. The finish is easy and rounds up the refreshing taste of the beer. Its actually so easy that after two of them youll be surprised by the alcohol content (7%) :)

No doubt this beer has been masterfully crafted and the result. Get this beer while it lasts (its limited!) to bridge the time gap until the next Tap X experiments outcome :).

From the English porter comes the dark brown, almost blackish color and also the mild roasting flavors, which remind me a bit of dark chocolate. Then the Bavarian Hefeweizen comes in with its fruity, spicy hints of raisins and nuts! A VERY SMOOTH, well-balanced beer with a VERY LIGHT, subtile aroma of hops leaves a dry- yet plesant mouthfeel. THIS BEER IS VERY DANGEROUS AS IT GOES DOWN SO, SO SMOOTH! I really couldnt notice the alcohol (7%) until it was already too late...Oh well, the night was pretty fun- as Im sure you could imagine!

They recommend pairing TAPX Meine Porter Weisse pairs with: hearty meats, all kinds of roasts, strong cheeses i.e. Gorgonzola, blue mold cheese, and/or desserts with hues of vanilla or nuts.

I havent tried any of those pairings yet but Im definitely looking forward to it! THIS BEER IS VERY LIMITED EDITION!!! So, if you are able to find one, then lucky you! 

Cheers!
